articles.contents:
Figure 1: Atlantic Forest landscape in southern Brazil



Olá




Jump to english version

Eu sou Arthur, doutorando em
Ecologia pela Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul. De maneira
ampla, meu interesse em ecologia é entender fatores e processos que
determinam e mantêm os padrões de biodiversidade, desde a escala
regional à escala continental. Atualmente, investigo como a história
evolutiva família Myrtaceae no Neotrópico influencia sua diversidade na
Mata Atlântica.
Faço pesquisas e
tenho interesse nos seguintes temas:
Modelos de distribuição de espécies;
Predição de cenários futuros para biodiversidade;
Influência da história evolutiva e da biogeografia em padrões de
biodiversidade e processos de montagem de comunidades;
Estratégias ecológicas das espécies (atributos funcionais) e sua
relação com processos de montagem de comunidades;
Influência de fatores antropogênicos sobre a biodiversidade.
Além disso, tenho grande interesse em programação com a linguagem R.
Uso o R para fins diversos, como análises de dados, criação de páginas
de web (como essa aqui), web app com {shiny},
mapas e visualização de
dados com {ggplot2} e sou mantenedor do pacote {naturaList}
disponível na CRAN.
Temos interesses em comum? Acha que eu posso te ajudar de alguma
forma? Entre em contato comigo: rodrigues.arthur.v@gmail.com
Hello
I’m Arthur, a PhD candidate in
Ecology at the Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil. In a
broad view, my interest in ecology is to understand factors and
processes that drive and maintain biodiversity patterns, from regional
to contiental scale. Currently, I investigate how the evolutionary
history of Myrtaceae species in the Neotropics influence its diversity
in the Brazilian Atlantic Forest.
I have made research and have
interest in the following areas:
Species distribution modeling;
Predicting future scenarios for biodiversity;
How evolutionary history and biogeography influence biodiversity
patterns and the metacommunity assembly processes;
Ecological strategy of species (functional traits) and its
relashionship with community assembly;
Anthropogenic factors influence on biodiveristy.
Beside that, I have great interest in programming using R language. I
have used R for several ends, such as data analysis, creating web pages
(like this one), web
apps using {shiny}, maps and data
visualization using {ggplot2}, and I am maintainer of the {naturaList}
package available at CRAN.
Do we have interests in common? Can I contribute with you in anyway?
Contact me at rodrigues.arthur.v@gmail.com

articles.description: Here I show some shiny apps I have developed. Click in the title to see the app.
articles.contents:
Contents
Tree Ferns
distribution and diversity
naturaList
Plant Traits
Dataset

Tree Ferns distribution
and diversity
 This app is part of the paper Expected impacts of
climate change on tree ferns distribution and diversity patterns in
subtropical Atlantic Forest.
In this paper, we show predictions of change in the distribution and
diversity of tree ferns in the subtropical Atlantic Forest due to
climate change.
In the app, you can see the predictions to the distribution of each
species (13) and to the diversity in 2050.
naturaList

This app was made for the 2019
GBIF Ebbe Nielsen Challenge and win the 3rd Prize in this
challenge.
naturaList app provides tools aiming at classify occurrence records
based on the confidence in the species identification. To conduct the
classification, the user should have an occurrence dataset downloaded
from GBIF, and a list of expert taxonomist in the taxon of interest. The
app provides full guideline to conduct the classification and
filtering.
Based on this work, an R package is in development to provide more
flexibility on the classification and cleaning of datasets in R.
Plant
Traits Dataset

This is, for shure, the challenger and the hardest app I have made.
Unfortunately, it is unfinished and only in Portuguese.
In this app, my objective was to share the images of wood branches
and stomata I shoted for my master thesis project.
My master thesis was focused in the investigation of plant trait
variation in the Atlantic Forest. For that, I collected more that 500
plant individuals, and measure several traits. Some of them were derived
from images took from branches and leaves.
In the app you can view images of the bracnhes, from panoramic view,
which enables to contrast area used for wood, bark and pith; and a
zoomed view, which enables to see the vessels and other wood elementes
in more details. In addition, you can see stomata in the upper side of
the leaf from several species.
You can access the paper and the dataset, which include the images
showed in the app, in this link.
